intro: Eureiandra parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved eureiandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many genera with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
